profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion June 26, 2009

did.unittitle: Alice and Rita Lawrence Papers,

physdesc.extent: 6.5 linear ft. ( 1 document box and 2 flat boxes).

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Alice Montgomery Lawrence and Rita (Margarita) Woodhull Lawrence (ca. 1867-1939?) were well-known amateur actresses in New York City during the 1880s and 1890s. Rita Lawrence also wrote an autobiographical memoir, Amateurs & Actors of the 19TH-20TH Centuries (American, English, Itlaian), (Menton, Fr., 1936).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, programs, clippings, and other theatrical memorabilia relating the the careers of Alice and Rita Lawrence.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 1971 M-71 Brander Matthews Dramatic Museum Transfer

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alice and Rita Lawrence Papers. Rare Book and Manuscript Library. Columbia University.

did.unittitle: Series I: Cataloged Correspondence and Manuscripts

scopecontent.p: This series contains incoming and outgoing correspondence to Alice and Rita Lawrence, and is arranged in alphabetical order by name.

Series II: Amateur Theater
Note: The series contains material related to the Lawrence sisters' work with theater, other personalities in theater, and charitable efforts.
Invoices, property lists New York, 1892-1893
Programs, flyers, awards New York, 1887-1892 Note: Including list of photographs transferred from the Alice and Rita Lawrence Scrapbooks to the Dramatic Museum Portrait File
Clippings New York, 1889-1896
Clippings on Sir Squire and Lady Bancroft New York, [n.d.] & 1926
My Turn Next and The Serenade [n.p.], 15 October 1892 1 poster
Ladies Society Presented to Misses Lawrence for the December 4 1888 production of Blue and Cherry [n.p.], 1888 1 satin banner Note: For the relief of sufferers of yellow fever
Series III: Scrapbooks
Note: The series contains five scrapbooks from the Lawrences' acting careers. The scrapbooks contain programs, souvenirs, and clippings.
Rita Lawrence Book 1 [n.p.], 1882-1891
Alice Lawrence Book 1 [n.p.], 1874-1889
Rita Lawrence Book 2 [n.p.], 1890-1893
Alice Lawrence Book 2 [n.p.], 1890-1892
Alice Lawrence Book 3 [n.p.], 1893-1895
